course.subject: RMBI
course.name: Risk Management in Society
course.description: Risk exists in every aspect of our life. Risk management is a concept used in many disciplines. This subject provides an opportunity for students to examine the various kinds of risk existing in society and learn about the benefits and impacts of risk management. The focus is on the definition and classification of risk  management, and its impact. The course focuses on risks in enterprise business, financial industry and our environment. Learning activities consist of a mixture of lectures, case studies, group discussion and seminars.

reviews.author: thanos
reviews.title: Super good grade and nice professor
reviews.comment_content:
The whole course is about basics of risk management and the usage of excel to help processing data and do simulations (e.g. what-if analysis)

The lecture notes are easy to understand even for a Year 1 student
Lec01 ‐ Introduction to Risk and
Probability
Lec02 ‐ Risk Management Process
Lec03 ‐ Risk Analysis: Qualitative and
Quantitative
Lec04 ‐ Financial Risk Management
Lec05 ‐ Market Risk and Diversification
Lec06 ‐ Market Risk and Hedging
Lec07 ‐ Market Risk and Value‐at‐Risk
Lec08 – Credit Risk Management
Lec09 – Asset Liability Management

The above content may seems to be hard for non-business school student, but in fact it's easy if you pay attention to her lectures.
(p.s. I'm an engineering Year 1 student)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice professor and willing to teach.
Will help you on your project and assignment if you ask her or send her the draft in advance
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grades
For me it's A+, my first A+ in UST
Exams with no MCs yet she gives marks so generously that you can get very high score

Normal weighting
10% tutorial exercises
10% Assignment 1
20% mid term
20% Assignment 2
40% Final
Extra 3% for class participation

Weighting due to some events happened
--Tutorials: 20% (was 10%)
--Assignment01: 20% (was 10%)
--Midterm Test: 30% (was 20%)
--Assignment02: 30% (was 20%)
reviews.comment_workload:
1 individual assignment
1 group project (which turns into an individual work for my semester)
1 mid term (with no MC and many long Q)
1 final exam (cancelled)
Tutorial exercise for every week (make sure you go to tutorials as she almost gives out answers during tutorials)

Overall speaking, the workload is manageable for me. The requirements for each assignment is not that high.
Exercises are exceptionally easy and can be finished within the tutorial
If you pay effort, you get the grades.

reviews.author: holam
reviews.title: RMBI 1010
reviews.comment_content:
Chp1/2: probability / utility / introduction
Chp3: risk analysis
Chp4: financial risk
Chp5: Portfolio and diversification /CAPM (FINA3103)
Chp6: Derivatives and hedging (FINA3203)
Chp7: VaR / Market risk
Chp8: credit risk
Chp9: asset and liquidity risk

Chapter 1-7 are covered by FRM L1
Chapter 8-9 are covered by FRM L2
However, the content taught in the course is only 1/30 from the whole FRM syllabus.

It is noted that there are many FINA/QFIN/RMBI year 3/4/5 ppl (at least 12 out of 48).
So after you enroll in this class, just linkedin all the names in canvas please to check the competitiveness

If you check other reviews, they said it is super good grade, since at that time most of the students are from RMBI (which indicates the professor has incentive to distribute more A range since she is the course coordinator of RMBI; another point to note is that she focuses a lot on your presentation skills and flow rather the actual content and the level of deepness)
reviews.comment_teaching:
No comment
There are two types of ppl in class
1. They don't know anything and try to listen
2. They know all the things and are not listening
reviews.comment_grading:
The speed that TA marks our work is super slow, on average it spends 1-2 months. Most of the marks are not released.

Attendance (5%)
Attend all the classes on campus / zoom
No attendence requirement for tutorial

Lab x9 (20%)
They can be completed in 30 minutes and prof will go through it. This part should be no worry but please be careful since TA will really check the correctness.

Summary writing (15%)
4-page writing with guided questions
No idea on how it will be graded.

Project (20%)
2-4 ppl a group, choose one of 15 topics given, 15 minute presentation +5 min Q&A, with peer evaluation
Submit the ppt on canvas also

The prof emphasize on the flow/structure of the presentation. Give real life examples. Please don't give technical things since she seems do not like (that is the mistake that I have made). Since she studies computer science, she seems not care how fancy your ppt is. But the flow and structure and presentation will be important. There are bonus point if you raise/ask questions in Q&A. Prof will really mark down the names. Seems one question one mark.

Final exam (40%) 3-hour
It is not difficult at all coz the topic tested are general. Specific topics like duration/dollar gap / RAROC /credit scoring/ unexpected loss / Expected shortfall are not asked (which should be asked instead).
All questions are short answered with sub questions.

Since she did not give me an A+, let me try to recap what is tested (give her a chance to rewrite the whole paper)

(If you know who I am, pm me and I can share to you the content)

So overall, the question are quite qualitative and require many explanations so I cannot guess the marking scheme easily. The professor emphasize that you don't need to memorize anything word by word and will give marks as long as you have the meaning, but no one knows will that actually happens.

Final grade: A only, should be my project sucks
reviews.comment_workload:
Not huge since no midterm
Project does not need written report
Only have 9 lectures
Only 2 hours lecture per week

reviews.author: Alexander
reviews.title: Interesting, but challenging
reviews.comment_content: This course covers the introductory materials to risk management, which includes the risk management model, diversification, hedging, and different types of risk. I had the pleasure of taking this course with zero background in economics, so the material was somewhat difficult to digest for me. Nonetheless, even if you are unfamiliar with economic or business vocabulary, you can fully comprehend the material after brief research. This course does have maths in it, but it is nothing extreme and there is a formula sheet given on the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Wang's lectures are very clear and conducted at a reasonable pace. Her lectures greatly complement the presentations and have a lot of examples that make understanding the concepts easier. Additionally, Ms. Wang is kind enough to have Q&A and review sessions after exams. Furthermore, she is always willing to answer questions and help you. You can get individual help from her if you schedule an appointment.
reviews.comment_grading:
The class used the following grading distribution:

- Tutorial Exercises (10%)
- Assignment 1 (10%)
- Assignment 2 (20%)
- Midterm Test (20%)
- Final Exam (40%)
- Class Participation (up to 3%)

Seems fair to me. The means for assignments and exams were relatively high.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload in this class is quite heavy. First of all, the material itself takes some time to comprehend (maybe im just dumb idk, depends on a person). There are weekly assignments that are covered during the tutorials. Fortunately, they are trivial as long as you attend the tutorial. Furthermore, there are two major assignment. The first assignment is an individual essay where you have to answer several questions. The second assignment is a group presentation + written report on a certain topic. Lastly, this course has both midterm and final exams.

reviews.author: Eddy Cheung
reviews.title: Practical and Interesting Course
reviews.comment_content: Interesting and applicable knowledge about risks in daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
A good use of multimedia and interactive sessions like Q&A, presentations and debates.

Students may encounter difficulty in understanding what the instructor says in class at first.
reviews.comment_grading:
Relative Grading; having a low nominal score doesn't mean poor performance. Try to get a decent standard score.

The most important factor for you to get a good performance in this course is to always attend the paper-checking session of all tests and exams. Since a large portion of questions in tests and exams are in short/long questions, the marks are surprisingly flexible and you should be aware of any possible debates/ ambiguities. 30% of the score could come from this.
reviews.comment_workload:
In term of number of items, there were a lot:

Weekly/ bi-weekly presentations/ case studies
3 essays (500 - 1000 words each)
1 debate (In groups of 3 - 4)

However in terms of intellectual capacity it is not very demanding; no advanced mathematical knowledge required.

reviews.author: Jonas Reu
reviews.comment_content: Introduction to Risk Management, mainly basics and qualitative, rather than quantitative. Interesting if you never heard of the topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teacher nad TA. Will help you if you need it. Pace sometimes a bit slow, but its a first year course. Teaching is structured well and her english good to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: High means, requires some time, but also not to much. Grades are better than in most of my other courses.
reviews.comment_workload: All right. More workload during the semester, than for exam preparation. You have to submit Excel quizes, a longer assignement and do a presentation.

reviews.author: Karlbear
reviews.title: Super Good Grade
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture covers Introduction of risk management process and different types of risks in company and society. The content focuses more on theories than calculation.
Tutorials teach you how to use Excel to calculate VaR, use What-if analysis, etc. Challenging but interesting. The content may be difficult for a year 1 student without any business background, but given that this is a common core and it does’t require you to 100% understand. So just feel relaxed to learn.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is OK, can explain concepts in detail and give some examples, but sometimes a bit confusing given that the content is not so easy. She is very nice and willing to answer you questions! She can help you finish the tutorial exercise if you have problems.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think this course is SUPER GOOD GRADE. Even though I am year 1 student, who doesn’t  have much business knowledge, I still get A+ at  the end! Try to do well in every assignment and you can have a good grade!!!

Assessment and Weighting:
Tutorial Exercises (20%): As long as you attend the tutorial and follow the instructions, you can get full marks.
Assignment 1(20%): 4-page Essay answering given questions based on your research.
Midterm(30%): All short questions+calculations based on the Lecture content.
(Memorise all the PPT and you get a good mark I think, not very easy)
Assignment 2(30%): PPT presentation + 12-page report based on your interesting topic.
Final was cancelled due to the social event! and Assignment 2 was changed to individual one, the presentation in class is changed to PPT recording.

My mark:
Midterm: 43/50, above 1 sd
Mean: 33.9 Sd:9
Other not released
I spend a lot time on the assignment, but the grade is still unexpected!!!
I believe mean is B or B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy for year 1 student. One tutorial exercise per week, but if you attend the tutorial, you can finish most of it in class! Assignment 1 and 2 is quite challenging as you should write a lot. I was not familiar with topic, so I spent much time doing research!!! Also, my English is not so good, so it is hard for me to write long essay and report.

Remember, good grade course still needs hard work!!!

reviews.author: heheguyguy
reviews.comment_content: Introduction of different risks in the society will be included in the course. There will be guest lectures provided during the semester. You can directly talk to those businessmen who are actually working in big firms. The contents are so fruitful and useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is very patient and nice. She will help dealing with your difficulties in your assignments or tasks. She will guide you to think correctly but not just giving you the answer.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade depends on your daily performance and the performance in the assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: There are weekly exercise, presentation, essay and exams.

reviews.author: vierisuherman
reviews.title: Good Course
reviews.comment_content: The content of this class was actually quite useful in our daily lives.  For business students (especially year 2 and above) should find some of the courses similar to the business core courses.  For engineering / science / humanities students, the course is quite good if interested in learning basic business.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was okay.  I sometimes find the class a bit boring and even skip a few every now and then.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was quite fair in my opinion.
Lab : 99/100 (9 sessions)
Assignment 1: 93/100
Assignment 2: 85/100
Midterm: 99/100
Final score wasn't released but i think i did pretty well
Final Grading: A
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was a bit higher than most common core courses, mainly because of the 2nd assignment which was a group presentation + report.  Overall it was okay, with another assignment which was an individual writing task, a midterm & a final.  No class attendance and lab attendance, but it's quite useful to attend the lab as she will help you with the weekly submissions.

reviews.author: IY
reviews.title: Dr. Jean Wang is nice
reviews.comment_content: The course is an introductory course on risk management. It covers topics like financial risk management, hedging and value at risk (VaR). It also involves some math calculations and use of Excel. But as a common core course, it does not go too deep. The calculations in exams are rather simple as a formula sheet is provided for both the midterm and final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Jean Wang is a very nice person. She is always willing to answer students' questions. In particular, she provides special office hours before the exams such that students can visit her office to ask questions. Her teaching is also clear as she provides quite some daily life examples such that students with no risk management background can also understand easily. She holds tutorials in which she teaches how to do the tutorial assignments. Clear demonstrations and explanations are given.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading. I guess the marking for the long questions in exams are quite lenient as the mean is quite high although there are many long questions in both exams. In fact, the mean for the essay and group assignment are also relatively high in my opinion so it is not that difficult to do well. I get A at last so just pay effort and should be fine.

Tutorial Exercises (10%)
Assignment 1 (10%)
Midterm Test (20%)
Assignment 2 (20%)
Examination (40%)
Class participation (up to 3%)
reviews.comment_workload: Relatively high workload as you have a tutorial assignment every week. There are also two assignments: individual and group. For the individual assignment, you have to write an essay of at most 4 pages. For the group assignment, in a group of 3, you have to do a presentation of 15 minutes and submit a report of less than 12 pages. These assignments are not difficult though. Also, there is only one lecture of 2 hours plus one tutorial per week.

reviews.author: smallpotatoes
reviews.title: Heavy workload course
reviews.comment_content:
Some finance, some isom, some risk management.
Medium difficulty for business student.

As a common core, it tries to be easier so it wont touch too much about the technical details, so me without any rmbi background is still fine
reviews.comment_teaching:
Skip all lectures and just google if you dont understand the technical details.

She is a good prof but you just dont have to use 2hrs in lecture. You can understand the PPT within 1hr
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair
Hard work pays

Tips: as it is a common core, it would not go deep in technical details so for most of the time, you dont need to know how the thing works like the margin account in clearing house (maybe the name is wrong, i forgot) unless it is mentioned in the tutorial.

Hence, it would save some time in studying lol

Midterm: 97/100
Others: did not release
I did badly in final

Overall grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
DEAD
1 midterm+1final+1 individual assignment+1 group project+weekly tutorial assignment
FINAL IS ACCUMULATIVE

only good thing is she doesnt take any attendance so you can skip any classes you wish:)

reviews.author: I.048S96
reviews.title: Average Course (I'd say RMBI1020 is better)
reviews.comment_content:
The content is fine. While RMBI1020 is more on the data mining side of RMBI, this is more on the financial, business side of the RMBI field of study.

Touches upon different risks that are posed towards financial institutions, banks ... etc: financial risk, operational risk, systematic risk and so on. There are many types of risks and you will be learning all of them within a very short period of time (because you have a project as well).

By the time you are sitting on the desk to study for your finals for RMBI 1010, you realize you don't have time to study everything. It's a lot of material but manageable I guess? If you are motivated and willing to go on to RMBI major?
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is Average.

She reads the presentation slides, provides examples when necessary, answers questions whenever you ask them (most of the students don't ask questions)
reviews.comment_grading: As a student who will probably not take any other Professor Jean Wang's Classes (she is extremely nice btw), one advice I can give you is: Remember and memorize everything on all the slides and you will probably get an A+ (not that I did or will for this course).
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is okay I guess.

All you have to do is do the tutorial assignments every week (almost).
Some of the assignments are quite challenging but the professor will mandate tutorial session attendance if that is the case.

You don't have to attend the lectures, there is no attendance. You don't have to attend the tutorial session as well. Just do the work, submit it somewhere else and that is totally fine.

There is no merit in being there for the lectures. So if you feel sleepy, just stay in your room, read over the slides and that will be fine.

The project is do-able. You have to do it with another person or with two extra-people. I guess you could even manage the workload on your own. It's not a difficult project. Just do some reading, make presentation slides and submit it before the deadline.

reviews.author: JasonTong
reviews.title: Useful and interesting course
reviews.comment_content: This course taught different types of risks, not just limited to market risks but also catastrophe risk etc. Overall, this course is teaching a lot of basic financial risk such as beta, risk-premium...
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Jean Wang was teaching so well, I had learnt so clearly about different types of risk. Also, there are guest speakers invited to classes for sharing, which was all real world experience from the risk management industry.
reviews.comment_grading: Good. Even I have mid term and assignments below mean, I still got a B+ in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: There is an essay-typed assignment, a project and several labs which attendance is needed. But all of these are really useful in a variety of aspect. Also, just one midterm and one final.

reviews.author: Anson tth
reviews.comment_content: Basics about risk management. Content includes value at risk, CAPM. Notes are well organised, easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Study notes are enough to understand the content. Seldom go lessons. There is quite a numbers of guest lecture, just skip all of them. If you have risk management or finance background, skip every lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
40% Final
30% Mid term
10% Project
20% Assignment

Easy to get above B
If you are above mean for final and mid term, you can get at least B+
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy workload. Assignment almost one per tutorial and project requires writing long essays.

reviews.author: Kitty Leung
reviews.comment_content: Simple and easy content with only four topics, namely risk management, business risk management, financial risk management, and environmental risk management.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite boring in the way that professor mostly teaches from lecture notes.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade. Basically one point one mark for examination, no matter how long the point you write. Have sample midterm and final papers and case study answers.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 midterm and 1 final examination both open-book, open-notes with a case study material, essay and calculation questions, 1 debate, 3 assignments, weekly tutorial, bi-weekly mini-presentation after reading a case in the tutorial lesson.

- Individual Assignments 30%
- Group Debate 15%
- Test 15%
- Exam 40%
